column1: #Text=Day 2 : Uruguay , Iran win three points each with late goals ; Portugal-Spain share the spoils
#Text=Yesterday , day two of the 2018 FIFA football World Cup , Uruguay defeated Egypt 1 – 0 with an 89th minute winner scored by José Giménez ;

#Text=Iran defeated Morocco 1 – 0 due to Aziz Bouhaddouz 's own goal moments before the final whistle ; and in the final match of the night , Portugal vs Spain , both the sides scored three goals , with Portuguese captain Cristiano Ronaldo scoring a late equaliser and completing his hat-trick .
#Text=Uruguayan forward Luis Suárez had multiple attempts on the goal , but was denied by goalkeeper Mohamed El Shenawy .
#Text=Both sides built up attacks in the first half , but could not convert any into a goal .
#Text=Just at the start of the second half , Suárez came close to scoring the opener of the day but was stopped .
#Text=Egypt made the first substitution of the game in the 50th minute , when Tarek Hamed was substituted off for Sam Morsy due to injury .
#Text=Uruguay created multiple chances in the second half as well , and Edinson Cavani came very close to putting the South Americans in the lead in the 88th minute , but the ball hit the goal post .
#Text=A minute later , in the 89th minute , José Giménez scored a header from Carlos Sánchez 's free kick .
#Text=Egypt 's Sam Morsy and Ahmed Hegazi were shown yellow cards in the injury time .
#Text=Uruguay had four shots on target in the entire match .
#Text=Egyptian shot-stopper Mohamed El Shenawy was elected the Budweiser Man of the Match .
#Text=Egypt 's Mohamed Salah , who scored 44 goals for Liverpool FC in the 2017 – 18 season , was an unused substitute .
#Text=After the match , Egypt 's coach Hector Cuper said , " Salah is an important player for us but you need to have a good team , and we have a good team .
#Text=HT Aziz Bouhaddouz 90+5'(o . g. ) Masoud Shojaei 10 ' Alireza Jahanbakhsh 47 ' Karim El Ahmadi 90+2 '
#Text=Referee : Gianluca Rocchi ( Italy ) Cristiano Ronaldo 4'(pen)Cristiano Ronaldo 44'Cristiano Ronaldo 88 ' Bruno Fernandez 28 ' ( 2 – 1 )
